verses.text: Like snow in summer or rain in harvest, honor is not fitting for a fool.

rsbNotes.title: Pr 26:1
rsbNotes.text: 26:1 The comparison is explicit (“Like . . . so”). The perceptible orderliness of nature should be paralleled in society’s estimation of human character.

verses.text: Like a fluttering sparrow or a darting swallow, an undeserved curse does not come to rest.

rsbNotes.title: Pr 26:2
rsbNotes.text: 26:2 The form is the same as in v. 1. Curses have no power to afflict someone who is innocent. Such a curse has meaning only as an expression of divine retribution.
